column4: I can't seem to be able to copy files to my Sony Ericsson cell phone using Bluetooth with Hardy.  What could be the problem?
you may need the gnome-bluetooth package
Alright.  I'll try that.
there's another package you might need too.. something named vfs obex something. let me get the name
the package's name is gnome-vfs-obexftp . don't forget to pair with the phone first
I was able to pair with the phone, and copy files off of it, but not send files to it.
I get "Operation not supported by backend"
setting your computer to "trusted" in your phone may help
Nope.  Doesn't work.
maybe your ericsson doesn't support OBEX push?
You mean the ability to store files on the phone?
I've done that using Windows in the past.
no, not the ability to store files
It supports "object push"
object push, file transfer, audio remote controller, and audio remote control target
i see.
What can I do?  Can aI send files using the terminal?
you should keep investigating your problem
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=747800 says feature not implemented
don't take ubuntuforums posts too seriously
https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/gvfs/+bug/203687
i can transfer files to my nokia using OBEX push. apparently not all devices are affected by this bug
